question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my last update in October 2023, the global situation surrounding SARS-CoV-2 has shown significant improvement, with widespread vaccination efforts and natural immunity contributing to a decline in severe cases and hospitalizations. However, the WHO's decision to declare the outbreak over by a specific date, such as August 31, 2024, will depend on various factors including the emergence of new variants, public health data trends, and the global response to COVID-19 at that time. While there are positive trends suggesting that it is plausible for the outbreak to be declared over by August 2024, uncertainty remains due to the potential for new variants or unforeseen public health challenges. Therefore, while I believe there is a reasonable chance that the WHO could declare the outbreak over by that date, I also recognize the inherent uncertainties involved in public health decisions. Given these considerations, I estimate a moderate probability of a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the Bahraini health ministry confirm more than one case of polio in Manama by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. For the purpose of this question:

1. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements.
2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.

If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, the question will resolve as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
The likelihood of the Bahraini health ministry confirming more than one case of polio in Manama by August 2024 can be assessed by considering several factors. First, polio is a highly contagious viral disease that has been largely eradicated in many parts of the world due to widespread vaccination efforts. However, there have been instances of vaccine-derived poliovirus outbreaks, particularly in areas with low vaccination coverage. 

Bahrain, as a country, has a relatively high vaccination rate, which decreases the probability of new polio cases. However, the potential for imported cases or vaccine-derived strains cannot be completely ruled out. The timeline until August 2024 is also significant; if there are any detected cases before this date, it could increase the likelihood of more cases being confirmed, especially if there is a lapse in vaccination coverage or if there are pockets of unvaccinated individuals.

Additionally, the requirement for confirmation by the Bahraini health ministry and reputable international news sources adds a layer of scrutiny that may influence reporting. If polio cases do emerge, the health ministry is likely to be vigilant in monitoring and reporting them, especially given the global focus on infectious diseases post-COVID-19.

Considering these factors, while the probability of more than one case being confirmed is not negligible, it is still relatively low due to Bahrain's vaccination status and the current global health context. Therefore, I estimate the probability of the question resolving YES to be modest.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) the WHO declares the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over, and (b) the Bahraini health ministry confirms more than one case of polio in Manama?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur by August 31, 2024:

(a) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

(b) The Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements and be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera). The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023, and only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question. If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

The combined question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the likelihood of both events occurring by August 2024, we need to analyze the current state of the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak and the polio situation in Bahrain.

(a) The WHO's declaration of the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak being over will depend on several factors, including global vaccination rates, the emergence of new variants, and the overall public health situation. As of now, while the situation has improved significantly due to vaccinations and treatments, the WHO has been cautious in declaring pandemics over, especially given the potential for new variants. There is a possibility that the WHO could declare the outbreak over by August 2024, but this is contingent on the global health landscape remaining stable without significant resurgence in cases.

(b) The confirmation of more than one case of polio in Manama is a different scenario. Bahrain has historically had very low incidence rates of polio due to effective vaccination programs. However, polio can still occur if there are gaps in immunity, particularly in communities with low vaccination rates. Given the current global focus on vaccination and disease prevention, the emergence of multiple cases in a specific area like Manama seems less likely but not impossible, especially if there are lapses in vaccination coverage or if there are travelers bringing the virus from areas where polio is endemic.

Both events are interdependent, meaning that for the overall question to resolve as YES, both conditions must be satisfied. Considering the cautious nature of health organizations and the current global health dynamics, I would estimate that the likelihood of both events occurring by August 2024 is moderate but not highly favorable.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of the Central Bank of Chile announcing a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024, we must consider several factors influencing monetary policy decisions. The Central Bank's interest rate decisions are typically based on economic indicators such as inflation, economic growth, and external economic conditions. As of now, if the economic outlook indicates a need for stimulus due to high inflation or slow growth, the Central Bank may consider rate cuts to encourage borrowing and spending. Recent trends in global and local economies, including inflation rates and economic growth forecasts, play a crucial role. If inflation is trending downwards and the economy is not overheating, a rate cut may be more likely. Additionally, the Central Bank's past behavior and any official statements regarding future monetary policy can provide insights into their intentions. However, the precise timing of such decisions can be unpredictable, and the political and economic landscape may change leading up to August 2024. Furthermore, the requirement for an official announcement from the Central Bank, as well as coverage by reputable news sources, adds another layer of uncertainty. Given the current economic conditions, if there are signs of easing inflation and economic slowdown, I would estimate a moderate probability of a rate cut announcement. Conversely, if inflation remains high or economic conditions worsen, the likelihood decreases. Considering these factors, I would estimate the probability of the Central Bank of Chile announcing a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024 to be around 0.45, reflecting a moderate likelihood of such an event occurring.

question.title: Will Brazil's monthly job growth fall below 50,000 in any single month by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Brazil records a monthly job growth figure below 50,000 in any official jobs report. The data must be confirmed by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics in their monthly employment reports. Job growth refers to the net change in employment. Revisions to previous months' data will not be considered for this question's resolution. If job growth does not fall below 50,000 in any month from October 2023 through July 2024, the question resolves as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the likelihood of Brazil's monthly job growth falling below 50,000 by July 2024, we need to consider several factors, including current economic conditions, labor market trends, and historical data. As of October 2023, Brazil has been experiencing fluctuations in its labor market, influenced by various factors such as economic policies, global economic conditions, and domestic demand. Historically, Brazil's monthly job growth has shown variability, with periods of both strong growth and declines. The Brazilian economy has been recovering from previous downturns, but uncertainties remain, including inflationary pressures and potential global economic slowdowns. If the economy faces significant challenges, it is plausible that job growth could dip below 50,000 in a month, especially in the context of seasonal employment variations or economic shocks. Given these considerations, while there is a possibility of job growth falling below 50,000, the Brazilian economy's recovery trajectory and efforts to stabilize employment suggest that it may be less likely for this to happen consistently. However, the potential for unexpected economic events or shifts cannot be disregarded. Considering these factors, I estimate the probability of monthly job growth falling below 50,000 in any single month by July 2024 to be moderate.

question.title: Will the Swiss National Bank announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Swiss National Bank officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official SNB communications, such as press releases, statements, or public speeches by SNB officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the policy rate, which is the SNB's primary tool for monetary policy.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the likelihood of the Swiss National Bank (SNB) announcing an interest rate cut by August 2024, we must consider several factors such as the current economic conditions in Switzerland, inflation rates, the SNB's historical policy decisions, and global economic trends. As of now, if inflation is high or economic growth is strong, the SNB may be less inclined to cut rates. Conversely, if there are signs of economic slowdown or deflationary pressures, a rate cut could be more likely. 

The SNB has been known to be cautious in its monetary policy, often waiting for clear signs of economic distress before making significant changes to interest rates. Additionally, the timing of such an announcement would be influenced by both domestic and international economic conditions leading up to the resolution date. 

Given that we are currently in June 2024 and we have seen economic indicators that suggest a mixed outlook, the probability of a rate cut announcement by August 2024 is moderate. If there are indications of an economic downturn or a need for stimulus, the SNB may decide to announce a cut. However, without clear signals pointing to such a decision, the likelihood remains uncertain.

Considering these factors, I estimate the probability of the SNB announcing an interest rate cut by August 2024 to be around 0.4, reflecting a moderate chance of such an announcement occurring.

question.title: Will the Indian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation of India. The question resolves as NO if the Indian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The Indian economy has shown resilience in the face of global economic challenges, with a projected GDP growth rate that remains relatively strong compared to many other economies. Factors such as government reforms, infrastructure investment, and a growing consumer market contribute positively to economic stability. While there are risks, including inflationary pressures and global economic slowdowns, the Indian government and Reserve Bank of India have tools at their disposal to mitigate these risks. Given the current economic indicators and trends, it seems more likely that the Indian economy will avoid a recession by July 2024. However, there is still some uncertainty, so while the probability of avoiding a recession is high, it is not absolute.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The likelihood of Indiana conducting a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 depends on several factors, including the current political climate, public sentiment regarding abortion, and the actions of state lawmakers. Indiana has a history of restrictive abortion laws, but there has also been significant public support for reproductive rights following the Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade. Given the changing dynamics and the potential for grassroots movements to gain traction, it is possible that lawmakers may feel pressured to respond to public demand by allowing a referendum. However, there are no concrete indications that such a referendum has been officially announced or is in the planning stages as of now. The timeline is tight, and the process of organizing a referendum typically requires time and legislative action, which may not happen before the deadline. Considering these factors, while there is a possibility that a referendum could be conducted, the lack of current announcements or plans makes it less likely. Therefore, I would estimate that the probability of Indiana conducting a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 is moderate but leaning towards the unlikely side.

question.body:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Minnesota state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The likelihood of Minnesota holding a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 can be assessed by considering several factors. First, the political climate surrounding abortion rights in the United States has been highly dynamic, especially following the Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade. Many states have seen increased advocacy and movements pushing for the protection of abortion rights. In Minnesota, there has been a strong push from various advocacy groups to ensure that abortion rights are protected at the state level. Additionally, the Democratic control of the state government may facilitate the process of organizing a referendum. The Minnesota legislature has been responsive to public sentiment on this issue, and there is a significant public interest in ensuring abortion rights are safeguarded. Moreover, the timeframe until August 2024 aligns with the general election cycle, which often sees increased voter engagement and discussions around key issues like abortion. This could provide the necessary momentum for a referendum. While it is still uncertain whether a referendum will be officially announced, the current political landscape suggests a reasonable chance that it could happen, especially given the ongoing debates and advocacy efforts in the state. However, there are also potential roadblocks, such as legislative hurdles or a lack of consensus within the government. Taking all of these factors into account, I estimate a moderate to high probability that Minnesota will hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To evaluate the probability that the UK economy will avoid a recession by July 2024, we need to consider several economic indicators and trends. As of October 2023, the UK economy has shown signs of resilience despite facing challenges such as inflation, rising interest rates, and global economic uncertainties. Recent data on GDP growth, employment rates, and consumer spending will be crucial in forecasting the likelihood of avoiding a recession. If the economy continues to grow or stabilize without two consecutive quarters of negative growth, the probability of avoiding a recession increases. However, risks remain, including potential external shocks (like geopolitical tensions or global economic downturns) and domestic challenges (such as inflationary pressures). If these factors do not lead to significant negative impacts on economic performance, the UK could maintain positive growth. Taking into account the current economic outlook, the resilience of various sectors, and the potential for policy interventions, I estimate that there is a moderate to high probability that the UK economy will avoid a recession by July 2024.

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its beverage products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its beverage products compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

metadata.chain_of_thought:

First, the political climate surrounding healthcare reform in Illinois and the U.S. at large is a critical factor. If there is substantial public support or political motivation for reform, this increases the chances of a referendum being held.

Second, the timeframe is relatively short, with only about two months remaining until the deadline of August 31, 2024. This tight schedule means that any movement towards a referendum would need to be initiated soon. The process of organizing a referendum, including drafting the question, gathering support, and officially announcing it, requires time and resources.

Additionally, the role of the Illinois Secretary of State or other election authorities is crucial. If there has been no prior indication or announcement of a referendum process as of now, the probability of one being initiated and scheduled in such a short time frame is diminished.

Considering these factors, while there is some potential for a referendum if there is public demand and political will, the lack of existing announcements and the limited time left lead me to conclude that the probability of Illinois holding a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024 is relatively low.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
The European Central Bank (ECB) has a history of adjusting interest rates in response to economic conditions, inflation rates, and overall financial stability in the Eurozone. As of the current economic climate in late 2023, inflation rates are a significant concern across Europe, and the ECB has been engaged in a tightening cycle to combat this. However, if the economic outlook shifts due to unforeseen circumstances, such as a recession or a significant easing of inflationary pressures, the ECB may consider an interest rate cut to stimulate growth.

Several factors could influence the likelihood of an interest rate cut by July 2024:
1. **Economic Data**: If economic indicators show a downturn or if inflation rates fall significantly, the ECB may pivot towards a more accommodative stance.
2. **Market Sentiment**: Financial markets often react to economic data and ECB communications. If market expectations shift towards a potential rate cut, it may influence the ECB's decision-making process.
3. **Geopolitical Events**: Events such as changes in energy prices, trade relations, or other geopolitical factors could impact the Eurozone economy and influence the ECB's decisions.

Given the current trajectory and potential for economic changes, there is a moderate chance that the ECB could announce a rate cut by July 2024, but it is not guaranteed. Therefore, I estimate the probability of a YES resolution to be around 30%, reflecting a cautious outlook on the likelihood of an official interest rate cut announcement.

question.title: Will the People's Bank of China announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?

Considering the current economic indicators and the PBoC's recent actions, there is a reasonable probability that they could announce a rate reduction by the specified date. However, the exact timing and decision will depend on the economic landscape leading up to August 2024.

Combined Probability = P(Buenos Aires restrictions) * P(PBoC rate reduction) = 0.6 * 0.7 = 0.42.

Thus, the overall probability that both events will occur by their respective deadlines is 0.42.

question.title: Will Florida hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

The timing is crucial, as any potential referendum would need to be organized and announced well in advance of the election season, which peaks in 2024. Additionally, there have been previous discussions and proposals regarding abortion rights in Florida, indicating that there is some level of momentum for a referendum. However, the state's leadership may be hesitant to allow a public vote on such a contentious issue, fearing backlash from conservative voters. Considering these factors, while there is a possibility that a referendum could be held, the political resistance and the time required for organization suggest that it is not highly likely.

question.title: Will the South Korean economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy does not enter a recession. question.title: Will the WHO declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:

2. The WHO makes a declaration about Lassa fever that does not specifically address the Nigerian outbreak.

The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the likelihood of the French economy avoiding a recession by July 2024, we must consider several factors, including current economic indicators, government policies, and global economic conditions. Historically, the French economy has shown resilience in the face of economic downturns, and there are signs of recovery in certain sectors. If these positive trends continue, it is plausible that the economy could avoid two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth. Therefore, I estimate a moderate to high probability that the French economy will avoid a recession by July 2024.

question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales show a decline for two consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month. The declines must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. Higher interest rates typically lead to increased mortgage rates, which can suppress home sales as borrowing becomes more expensive. 2. **Seasonality of Home Sales**: Historically, the housing market experiences seasonal fluctuations, with sales typically peaking in the spring and summer months. However, if the market is already showing signs of weakness due to economic conditions, this seasonal peak may not be as pronounced, potentially leading to declines in sales. 3. **Recent Data**: As of the latest data available, the housing market has been facing challenges, including affordability issues and a decrease in buyer demand. If these trends continue into 2024, it is plausible that there could be two consecutive months of declining sales. 4. **Market Predictions**: Analysts from sources like the National Association of Realtors often provide forecasts based on current data. Given these factors, while there is a reasonable chance that we could see two consecutive months of decline due to economic pressures and seasonal factors, it is difficult to predict with certainty. question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The likelihood of the House of Lords passing a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024 can be analyzed through several factors. 1. Political Landscape: The House of Lords has a history of scrutinizing and sometimes opposing government legislation, particularly when it comes to significant economic reforms. If there is a strong public or political push for reform, it is plausible that the Lords would support a bill that aligns with those sentiments, even if it opposes the Prime Minister. 2. Current Economic Climate: The UK economy is facing various challenges, including inflation, cost of living crises, and public spending pressures. Economic reforms are often discussed in response to these challenges, and if there is a pressing need for reform, it could lead to the introduction of a significant bill. 3. Opposition Dynamics: If Sunak's administration is perceived as out of touch or ineffective, there may be a stronger incentive for the Lords to pass a bill that opposes his stance. Additionally, if there are factions within the Conservative Party or external pressures from opposition parties, this could increase the chances of a significant bill being passed. 4. Media Coverage: For the question to resolve as YES, the opposition from Sunak must be well-documented by at least two major news sources. Given the current media landscape, significant economic reforms are likely to attract attention and coverage, especially if they are contentious. 5. Legislative Process: The timeline until August 2024 allows for the introduction and debate of such a bill, especially if economic conditions warrant it. The House of Lords typically reviews and can amend legislation, which may also lead to the passage of a bill that meets the criteria outlined. Overall, while there are uncertainties, the current political and economic context suggests a reasonable probability that the House of Lords could pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by the specified date.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?

question.title: Will the Dream Chaser spacecraft complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?

4. **Current Status**: As of late 2023, there are no confirmed crewed missions scheduled for Dream Chaser by August 2024. While it is possible that plans could be accelerated, it seems more likely that any crewed missions would be further into the future.

Taking all these factors into account, while there is potential for a crewed mission to occur, the lack of confirmed schedules and the complexities involved suggest that the likelihood of the Dream Chaser completing a crewed return mission from the ISS by the specified date is relatively low.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July-August 2024: (a) the Dream Chaser spacecraft completes a crewed return mission from the ISS and (b) the United States and South Korea implement a new form of cooperation?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. By August 31, 2024, the Dream Chaser spacecraft successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:
   - The mission must involve the Dream Chaser spacecraft transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
   - The spacecraft must land safely with all crew members in good health.
   - The mission's success must be officially confirmed by Sierra Nevada Corporation or another authoritative space agency.
   - The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).
   - The question will resolve as NO if no such mission occurs by the specified date, a mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria, or the Dream Chaser spacecraft is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.
   - Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

2. By July 31, 2024, the United States and South Korea have publicly announced the implementation of a new form of cooperation as part of a bilateral action plan. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from either the US or South Korean government and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or major national news agencies of either country). A 'new form of cooperation' refers to a collaborative initiative or agreement that is distinctly different from their existing partnerships as of October 1, 2023. This could include, but is not limited to, joint ventures in emerging technologies, novel trade agreements, or innovative cultural exchange programs. If no such implementation is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

The question will resolve as YES only if both conditions are satisfied within their respective time frames.

To evaluate the probability of both conditions being met by their respective deadlines, we need to consider the current status of both the Dream Chaser spacecraft and the geopolitical context between the United States and South Korea.

1. **Dream Chaser Spacecraft Mission**: As of now, the Dream Chaser spacecraft, developed by Sierra Nevada Corporation, has undergone several successful uncrewed tests. However, the timeline for its first crewed mission has been somewhat uncertain, with various delays in the broader context of commercial spaceflight. While there is optimism about its capabilities, the requirement for a successful crewed return mission by August 31, 2024, adds a layer of uncertainty. Given the complexity and risks involved in crewed space missions, I would assess a moderate likelihood of this condition being met, perhaps around 50%.

2. **US-South Korea Cooperation**: The geopolitical relationship between the United States and South Korea has been strong, and there have been ongoing discussions about enhancing cooperation in various domains, including technology and security. Given the current global context, including challenges posed by neighboring countries, it is plausible that a new form of cooperation could be announced by July 31, 2024. The likelihood of this happening appears to be relatively high, perhaps around 70%.

To resolve the overall question as YES, both conditions must be satisfied. Therefore, we can use the probabilities of each condition being met to calculate the overall probability. Assuming independence between the two events, the combined probability would be:

P(A and B) = P(A) * P(B) = 0.50 * 0.70 = 0.35.

Thus, while there's a reasonable chance of both events occurring, the overall probability remains below 50%, indicating a more cautious outlook.

question.title: Will TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. The reports or warnings must specifically mention TikTok's AI and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

Several factors support a YES resolution:
1. Historical Context: Previous elections have seen increased scrutiny of social media platforms for misinformation, suggesting a likelihood of similar reports arising in the upcoming election cycle.
2. Regulatory Environment: There is a growing trend among governments and regulatory bodies to monitor and address misinformation, especially in the context of elections. This implies that there will be mechanisms in place to investigate and report on platforms like TikTok.
3. Media Coverage: Major news organizations are likely to continue their investigative reporting on misinformation, and TikTok's prominence means it will be a focal point for such coverage.
4. User Behavior: The nature of TikTok's content recommendation algorithm, which promotes content based on engagement rather than accuracy, may lead to the spread of misleading information, increasing the likelihood of reports being generated.

However, there are uncertainties:
- The timing and specificity of any reports may vary, and it's possible that they may not meet the criteria outlined in the resolution.
- The effectiveness of misinformation mitigation strategies by TikTok and other platforms could reduce the incidence of such reports.

Taking these factors into account, I believe there is a reasonable chance that credible reports will surface by the resolution date.

If markets are pricing in a cut, it suggests a consensus that a decrease is probable. 4. External Factors: Global economic conditions, such as changes in trade policies, international interest rates, and geopolitical events, could also influence the decision of the Central Bank of Mexico. Given these considerations, if the economic indicators suggest a stable or improving economy with manageable inflation, and if recent statements from the Central Bank lean towards accommodating monetary policy, the probability of an interest rate cut by July 2024 is relatively high. metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of U.S. weekly jobless claims exceeding 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024, we need to consider several economic factors. As of mid-2024, the U.S. economy is experiencing a mix of challenges, including inflationary pressures, potential interest rate adjustments, and varying employment levels across sectors. If the labor market begins to weaken due to economic conditions or other external shocks, it is plausible that jobless claims could rise above 250,000. Given the historical data, jobless claims have spiked during downturns, and while they have been relatively low in recent times, the potential for a sudden increase exists, especially if economic conditions worsen. Therefore, while the current job market may not indicate a high likelihood of claims exceeding 250,000 for five consecutive weeks, the uncertainty surrounding economic conditions and the potential for unexpected events lead to a moderate probability of this scenario occurring. question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for Frito-Lay snacks by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Frito-Lay snacks compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Frito-Lay snacks in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess whether PepsiCo will report increased North American demand for Frito-Lay snacks by July 2024, we can consider several factors. First, the overall snack food market has been experiencing growth, driven by trends in convenience and snacking habits, particularly post-pandemic. Frito-Lay, being a leading brand in this sector, is likely to benefit from these trends. Additionally, PepsiCo has a history of strong brand loyalty and innovative product introductions, which can contribute to increased demand. Furthermore, by the time of the report in July 2024, we can expect that PepsiCo will have strategies in place to adapt to market changes and consumer preferences, potentially leading to an increase in demand. Economic indicators and consumer spending trends leading up to that date will also play a role; if the economy remains stable or improves, consumer spending on snacks is likely to increase. However, there are risks to consider, such as competition from other snack brands, changing consumer preferences towards healthier options, and potential economic downturns that could affect consumer spending. If these factors negatively impact Frito-Lay's market position, they could hinder demand growth. Overall, while there are uncertainties, the combination of market trends, brand strength, and consumer behavior suggests a reasonable likelihood that PepsiCo will report an increase in demand for Frito-Lay snacks by July 2024.

Given these considerations, while there are challenges, the likelihood of a referendum occurring in Missouri by the specified date appears reasonably high, particularly if there is significant public support and mobilization around the issue.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official ECB communications, such as press releases, Governing Council statements, or public speeches by ECB officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the main refinancing operations rate, which is the ECB's primary tool for monetary policy.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the likelihood of the European Central Bank (ECB) announcing an interest rate cut by August 2024, we need to consider several factors. First, the current economic environment and inflation trends in the Eurozone will play a crucial role in the ECB's decision-making process. If inflation remains high, the ECB may be less likely to cut rates, as they typically raise rates to combat inflation. Conversely, if economic growth is slowing and inflation is under control, the ECB may consider a rate cut to stimulate the economy.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The Rift Valley Fever (RVF) outbreak in East Africa has been a significant public health concern, particularly due to its potential impacts on livestock and human health. As of now, the WHO has been actively monitoring the situation, and while the outbreak has shown signs of being controlled in some areas, the decision to declare it no longer a global emergency will depend on several factors, including the epidemiological situation, vaccination coverage, and the presence of any new outbreaks or cases. The WHO typically makes such declarations based on thorough assessments of the situation, including the risk of transmission and the effectiveness of control measures. If the situation improves significantly, it is plausible that the WHO could declare the emergency status lifted by August 2024. However, given the unpredictable nature of infectious disease outbreaks and the potential for new cases or outbreaks to emerge, there is still a considerable level of uncertainty. Additionally, the requirement for the declaration to be reported by at least two major international news outlets adds another layer of scrutiny. If the situation improves but is not deemed stable enough, or if new cases arise, the WHO may choose to maintain or even escalate the emergency status. Considering these factors, while there is a reasonable chance that the WHO could declare the outbreak no longer a global emergency by August 2024, it is also quite possible that the situation may not stabilize sufficiently to warrant such a declaration. Therefore, I would estimate a moderate probability for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) the WHO declares the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency, and (b) Hormel Foods issues a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak?
question.body:
1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN) and must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

2. Hormel Foods must officially announce a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak by August 31, 2024. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources: an official announcement on Hormel Foods' website or social media channels, a press release from Hormel Foods, an announcement from the U.S. FDA or CDC specifically mentioning a Hormel Foods recall, or reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources. The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal.

The question will resolve as YES only if both conditions are met by the specified date. If either or both conditions are not met, the question will resolve as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the probability of both events occurring by August 2024, we need to consider the likelihood of each individual event happening.

1. **WHO Declaration on Rift Valley Fever:** The WHO's declaration regarding the Rift Valley fever outbreak will depend on the epidemiological situation in East Africa. As of late 2023, outbreaks of Rift Valley fever can be influenced by various factors, including climate conditions, animal health, and public health interventions. If the outbreak is effectively contained and does not pose a significant threat by mid-2024, it is plausible that the WHO would declare it no longer a global emergency. However, given the unpredictable nature of infectious disease outbreaks, there is still a degree of uncertainty. I would estimate a moderate probability of around 60% for this declaration being made.

2. **Hormel Foods Recall due to Listeria:** Food safety recalls, particularly due to listeria, can occur with little warning, especially if testing detects contamination. Hormel Foods has a history of recalls, and if there is an uptick in reported cases of listeriosis linked to deli meats, it is likely that they would act swiftly to protect consumers. Given the ongoing monitoring of food safety and the proactive measures taken by companies in response to potential health threats, I would estimate a higher probability for this event, around 70%.

To find the overall probability that both events occur, we can multiply the probabilities of each independent event happening, assuming they are independent:

P(both events) = P(WHO declaration) * P(Hormel recall) = 0.60 * 0.70 = 0.42.

Thus, I would assign a probability of 0.42 for both events occurring by August 2024.

question.title: Will Stellantis receive over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Stellantis is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives. These initiatives may include manufacturing, assembly, or other aspects of electric vehicle production. The confirmation must come from official government announcements, Stellantis' official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The grants must be specifically allocated for electric vehicle-related projects and not for general automotive purposes. If no such confirmation is made by the specified date, or if the confirmed amount is $500 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Stellantis, like many other automakers, is actively pursuing electric vehicle (EV) initiatives in response to the growing demand for sustainable transportation and government incentives aimed at reducing carbon emissions. The U.S. government has been allocating substantial funds to promote electric vehicle production, especially as part of broader climate change initiatives. Several factors suggest a high likelihood that Stellantis will receive over $500 million in grants by July 2024. Firstly, Stellantis has been engaged in numerous partnerships and projects aimed at expanding its EV offerings, which may make it a strong candidate for federal grants. Secondly, the Biden administration has been focusing on supporting the automotive industry in transitioning to electric vehicles, which has led to significant funding opportunities for manufacturers. Moreover, Stellantis has previously announced ambitious plans for electric vehicle production, indicating a commitment to investing in this area. Given the current political and economic climate favoring EV development, it is plausible that Stellantis will secure the necessary funding to exceed the $500 million threshold. However, uncertainties remain, such as the specific allocation processes of the grants, competition from other manufacturers, and potential changes in government policy. These factors could affect the final outcome, but overall, the trend towards supporting electric vehicle initiatives makes a YES resolution more likely.

question.title: Will the United Auto Workers endorse Elizabeth Warren for president by July 2024?

If no endorsement is made by the resolution date, or if the UAW endorses a different candidate, the question resolves as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of the United Auto Workers (UAW) endorsing Elizabeth Warren for president by July 2024, we need to consider several factors. First, Elizabeth Warren's stance on labor issues aligns well with the interests of the UAW, which typically supports candidates who advocate for workers' rights and unions. Second, Warren has a strong following among progressives and labor advocates, which could influence the UAW's decision. However, the political landscape is dynamic, and endorsements can be affected by various factors, including other candidates entering the race, changes in public opinion, and the UAW's internal priorities.  As of now, there are no indications of a formal endorsement by the UAW for Warren, and there are potential competitors who may attract UAW support, such as other Democratic candidates who may have stronger ties to labor. The UAW's endorsement process is also typically influenced by the political climate closer to the election date, which adds uncertainty. Given these considerations, while it is plausible that the UAW could endorse Warren, it is also quite possible they may choose another candidate, especially if they feel that candidate has a better chance of supporting labor interests or winning the election. Considering these factors, I would estimate a moderate probability that the UAW will endorse Elizabeth Warren by the deadline, but not overwhelmingly so.

question.title: Will Hyundai initiate a recall of over 720,000 vehicles due to a seatbelt issue by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Hyundai has officially announced and begun the process of recalling more than 720,000 vehicles due to an issue with the seatbelt system. The recall must be specifically related to seatbelts that may not properly secure passengers, as mentioned in the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) report. Confirmation of the recall initiation must come from official Hyundai statements or reports by at least two reputable news sources. The question resolves as NO if Hyundai has not announced or begun such a recall by the specified date, or if the number of vehicles affected is 720,000 or fewer.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
The likelihood of Hyundai initiating a recall of over 720,000 vehicles due to a seatbelt issue by August 2024 can be analyzed based on several factors. First, the automotive industry is highly regulated, and safety issues related to seatbelts are taken seriously, especially given the potential risks to passengers. If there is a credible report from the NHTSA indicating a significant issue with the seatbelt system, it is plausible that Hyundai would act to protect consumers and mitigate liability.

Moreover, the size of the recall being over 720,000 vehicles suggests that it would likely attract media attention, leading to public pressure on Hyundai to address the issue promptly. The presence of official statements or reports from reputable news sources would further support the likelihood of a recall.

Considering these factors, if there are indications or early reports suggesting that the seatbelt issue is serious enough to warrant such a large-scale recall, it increases the probability of Hyundai initiating the recall by the specified date. 

However, without current data on the situation as of June 2024, I must account for the uncertainty. If no significant developments or announcements have been made by then, the likelihood of a recall decreases. 

Taking all of this into account, I estimate the probability of Hyundai initiating a recall of over 720,000 vehicles due to a seatbelt issue by August 2024 to be moderate to high, but not certain, given the time frame and potential for developments in the coming months.

Taking all these factors into account, while there is potential for Hyundai to achieve a 20% increase in net income, it depends heavily on the continuation of positive trends in the automotive market and the company's execution of its strategies. Given the uncertainty, I would estimate a moderate probability that Hyundai's quarterly net income will increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024.

question.title: Will the Brazilian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Brazilian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Brazilian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the likelihood of the Brazilian economy avoiding a recession by July 2024, we must consider several factors, including current economic indicators, government policies, global economic conditions, and historical trends. As of now, Brazil has been facing challenges such as inflation, currency fluctuations, and external pressures from global markets. However, recent policies aimed at stabilizing the economy and promoting growth, along with potential recovery in key sectors, suggest a possibility of avoiding a recession. 

While there are risks associated with external shocks, such as commodity price fluctuations and geopolitical tensions, the Brazilian government has shown resilience in managing economic downturns in the past. If these policies continue to support economic growth and if external conditions remain stable, the likelihood of avoiding two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth increases.

Considering these factors, I estimate a moderate to high probability that Brazil will avoid a recession by the specified date.

question.title: Will the Hang Seng Index reach or exceed 30,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Hang Seng Index reaches or exceeds 30,000 points. The 30,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. If the index does not reach 30,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 30,000 points.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
The Hang Seng Index, like any stock market index, is influenced by various factors including economic conditions, investor sentiment, geopolitical events, and corporate earnings. As of October 2023, the global economic outlook is mixed, with some regions recovering from the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic while others face challenges such as inflation, interest rate hikes, and geopolitical tensions. The Hang Seng Index has historically shown volatility, and while it may have experienced fluctuations around the 30,000 points mark, reaching or exceeding this threshold by August 2024 will depend on several unpredictable factors.

If the Chinese economy continues to recover and there is positive sentiment in the markets, it is plausible for the Hang Seng Index to reach or exceed 30,000 points. However, if there are significant negative events or economic downturns, it could remain below this level. Given the current economic conditions and historical performance, I estimate a moderate probability that the Hang Seng Index will reach or exceed 30,000 points by August 2024.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the probability that both conditions will be met, we need to analyze the economic outlook for Brazil and the performance of the Hang Seng Index. 

1. **Brazilian Economy**: As of now, Brazil is facing various economic challenges, including inflationary pressures and global economic conditions. However, the Brazilian government and central bank have been implementing measures to stabilize the economy. Given the current economic data and forecasts, the likelihood of Brazil avoiding a recession by July 2024 seems moderate. However, there is a risk of economic downturn due to external factors like commodity prices and global economic slowdowns. I would estimate the probability of Brazil avoiding a recession at around 60%.

2. **Hang Seng Index**: The Hang Seng Index's performance is influenced by several factors, including China's economic recovery, global market trends, and investor sentiment. To find the overall probability that both conditions are met, we can multiply the probabilities of each independent event:

So, the combined probability is: 0.60 * 0.55 = 0.33 or 33%.

Thus, I would estimate the overall probability that both conditions will be met as relatively low, as both events need to happen together.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Italy's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Meloni by August 2024?

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Meloni or her administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Italian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the likelihood of Italy's Senate passing a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni by August 2024, we must consider several factors. First, the political landscape in Italy can be quite dynamic, and the relationship between the Senate and the Prime Minister's office plays a crucial role. If there is significant opposition from the public or other political parties, it could lead to the Senate pushing through reforms that the Prime Minister opposes, particularly if they are perceived as necessary for economic recovery or growth.

Second, the definition of a "major" economic reform bill is subjective but typically relates to significant changes in fiscal policy, taxation, or monetary policy that could impact the economy substantially. Given the economic challenges Italy faces, including issues like high public debt and slow growth, there may be increased pressure on the government to implement substantial reforms, even if they are opposed by the Prime Minister.

question.title: Will Mexico's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President López Obrador by August 2024?

Given these considerations, while the current political environment favors the president, the potential for economic crises and shifting political alliances could create conditions under which a significant reform bill passes in opposition to him.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the mpox outbreak in Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:

2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the African mpox outbreak, not a global mpox situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about mpox that does not specifically address the African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the African mpox outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the African mpox outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

The trajectory of infectious diseases can change rapidly based on public health measures, vaccination rates, and global health responses. If the trend shows a decline in cases and effective management of the outbreak, it is plausible that the WHO may consider downgrading its emergency status. 2. Public Health Data: The decision to declare an emergency or not often relies on epidemiological data. If the data indicates that the outbreak is under control and poses a significantly reduced risk to global health, the WHO may decide to declare it no longer a global emergency. 3. Global Health Priorities: The WHO's focus and resources are often allocated based on the most pressing global health threats. If other health emergencies arise or if the mpox outbreak is perceived as manageable, this could lead to a declaration that it is no longer a global emergency. 4. Historical Precedents: Looking at past outbreaks, the WHO has sometimes declared emergencies that were later downgraded, depending on the situation. If the global response to mpox is effective, this could lead to a positive outcome for the question. 5. Public Communication: The requirement that the declaration be reported by at least two major news outlets suggests that there needs to be a significant level of confidence and clarity in the WHO's communications. If the WHO is proactive in addressing mpox and communicates effectively about its status, the probability of a YES resolution increases. Considering these factors, while there is some uncertainty, the likelihood of the WHO declaring the mpox outbreak in Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024 seems moderately favorable, given the potential for improved outbreak management and declining case numbers.

The confirmation must come from a Kentucky state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The question of whether Kentucky's near-total abortion ban will be declared constitutional by August 2024 hinges on several factors, including the current legal landscape regarding abortion laws in the United States, particularly in the wake of the Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade. Since that decision, many states have passed restrictive abortion laws, and some have faced legal challenges. As of October 2023, Kentucky's near-total abortion ban was blocked but is awaiting assessment. The political climate in Kentucky, along with the composition of the state courts, will play a significant role in any ruling regarding the constitutionality of this law. Given the current trend in some states to uphold restrictive abortion laws, there is a possibility that a Kentucky court could rule in favor of the ban. However, there is also considerable opposition to such laws, both legally and socially, which could lead to a ruling against the ban. The requirement that the ruling must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources adds an additional layer of scrutiny and credibility to the ruling, which may affect the timing and the likelihood of such a confirmation. Since the legal proceedings could be prolonged and contentious, it is uncertain whether a definitive ruling will be made by the deadline. Given these factors, I would estimate that the probability of the ban being declared constitutional by August 2024 is moderate, reflecting both the potential for a ruling in favor of the ban and the significant opposition that exists.

question.title: Will Intelsat emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Intelsat officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. The emergence must be confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official company statements or court documents. The emergence should involve a court-approved reorganization plan that allows Intelsat to continue operations with a restructured financial position. If Intelsat remains in bankruptcy proceedings, is liquidated, or fails to emerge from bankruptcy by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the probability of Intelsat emerging from bankruptcy by July 2024, we must consider several factors. First, Intelsat filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in May 2020, and since then, the company has been working on a restructuring plan. As of now, there have been ongoing negotiations and discussions with stakeholders, which suggests that there is a pathway toward emergence.

However, the timeline is critical. The company needs to finalize a court-approved reorganization plan and secure the necessary approvals before the July 2024 deadline. The complexity of bankruptcy proceedings, potential opposition from creditors, and market conditions could impact the likelihood of a successful emergence.

Additionally, the financial health of the company, its ability to generate revenue, and the overall market conditions for the satellite communications industry will play a significant role. If Intelsat has made substantial progress in its restructuring efforts and has the support of its creditors, the probability of emerging from bankruptcy increases.

Taking into account these factors, while there are uncertainties involved, the ongoing efforts and the time remaining until the deadline suggest a moderately optimistic outlook. Therefore, I estimate a probability of approximately 0.65 that Intelsat will successfully emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024.

question.title: Will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the probability of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolving a major workers' strike by July 2024, we need to consider several factors. 

1. **Current Labor Relations**: The state of labor relations at Nissan is crucial. If tensions are high and negotiations are ongoing, the likelihood of a strike could increase. Conversely, if there are ongoing negotiations that suggest a resolution is possible, this would increase the probability of a YES resolution.

2. **Historical Context**: Looking at past strikes within the automotive industry, especially at Nissan, we can see patterns in how these disputes are typically resolved. If similar strikes in the past have been resolved through negotiation within a few months, this could suggest a higher probability of resolution.

3. **Union Strength**: The strength and organization of the union representing the workers also play a significant role. A strong, well-organized union is more likely to negotiate effectively and reach an agreement.

4. **External Factors**: Economic conditions, public sentiment, and political pressures can influence the likelihood of a resolution. If the economic environment is favorable and public support for the workers is strong, this may push both parties towards a resolution.

5. **Time Frame**: The deadline of July 31, 2024, provides a clear timeline. If negotiations are already underway and both parties appear to be working towards a resolution, the probability of a YES outcome increases. 

Given these factors, if there are signs of ongoing negotiations and a willingness from both sides to reach an agreement, I would estimate a relatively high probability of resolution. However, if there are significant tensions or lack of progress, it would lower the probability.

Considering all these factors, I would estimate the probability of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolving the strike by the specified date as moderate to high.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the likelihood of the Italian economy avoiding a recession by July 2024, we must consider several factors, including current economic indicators, government policies, external economic conditions, and historical trends. As of late 2023, the Italian economy has shown signs of resilience following the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and subsequent recovery efforts. Key indicators such as GDP growth rates, unemployment rates, and consumer confidence will play a crucial role in determining whether the economy can sustain growth. If the economy continues to show positive growth in the last quarter of 2023 and the first half of 2024, it will be less likely to experience two consecutive quarters of negative growth. Moreover, European economic conditions, including inflation rates and energy prices, could significantly impact Italy's economic performance. If external factors remain stable and the Italian government implements effective economic policies, the likelihood of avoiding a recession increases. However, the potential for unforeseen events, such as geopolitical tensions or global economic downturns, cannot be ignored, as they could lead to a downturn in the Italian economy. Considering these factors, I estimate that there is a moderate to high probability that the Italian economy will avoid a recession by July 2024, given the current trends and potential for positive growth.
